Title: Feature Stories - Points north: the future on display in Lithuania…
Teaser:
Read ftp://ftp.cordis.europa.eu/pub/lithuania/docs/11983_lt.pdf (this article in Lithuanian here) 

 More than 4000 researchers, innovators, entrepreneurs and young people from the field of 'Information and communications technologies' (ICT) are making their way to Lithuania for http://ec.europa.eu/digital-agenda/en/ict-2013 (ICT 2013) , taking place in Vilnius from 6 to 8 November. The event, which includes a conference and an exhibition, will focus on http://ec.europa.eu/research/horizon2020/index_en.cfm (Horizon 2020) - the EU's Framework Programme for Research and Innovation for 2014-2020. If you want to find out how to participate, or learn more about the future of cloud computing, broadband, ICT infrastructures, e-Skills, cyber-security and much more, then this is the place to watch.

Title: Innovative EU research hones in on HIV
Teaser: The two viruses that are the cause of the world’s two currently ongoing pandemics are very different from each other. One can fiendishly jump from host to host with incredible ease and causes a mild respiratory illness in most patients (though the jury is still out on the longer-term implications of the disease), with many infected people being completely asymptomatic. The second virus is mostly transmitted through unprotected sex, can lay unnoticed in its host for many years before it causes symptoms and can be fatal if left untreated.

Title: Infusing the digital into European education
Teaser: To be successful in the modern workforce, students need to be equipped with the skills that are most in demand from employers. The ability to write well, analyse and problem solve are the crucial classic ‘soft’ skills that are highly sought, but digital skills have become just as valuable and cherished. The global marketplace is increasingly dominated by technology, and the digital realm is seeping into all aspects of life and the economy.

Title: Oceans under threat: Protecting and preserving our maritime environments
Teaser: From climate change and plastics pollution, to overfishing and the destruction of coral reefs, the world’s oceans are reeling from human activities that together are building up into a terrifying environmental disaster. The future of human civilisation is dependent on healthy oceans (especially as they cover 71 % of the Earth’s surface) and action needs to be taken now to safeguard their complex biodiversity for future generations.

Title: Launch of EU Research Project “ENLIGHTENme”: Exploring the Impact of Urban Lighting on Health and Wellbeing
Teaser: Interdisciplinary consortium of 22 partners will perform in-depth studies in three European cities to develop innovative, evidence-based policies to improve citizens’ quality of life addressing indoor and outdoor lighting. Funded through the European Union’s Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme, the project will receive EUR 5 million over the next four years. Together with five other projects, ENLIGHTENme is part of the EU’s new “Urban Health” cluster.
